content:
The High Line and Riverside Park are both fantastic choices!

And, of course, NYC has a plethora of amazing museums to explore! Since you've already visited the Met, here are some other world-class museums to consider:

1. **The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)**: One of the most famous modern art museums in the world, with a collection of works by Warhol, Pollock, Picasso, and many more.
2. **The Guggenheim Museum**: Designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, this iconic museum features an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art, including works by Kandinsky, Miró, and Klee.
3. **The American Museum of Natural History**: Explore the wonders of the natural world at this beloved museum, featuring dinosaur fossils, a giant blue whale, and much more.
4. **The Whitney Museum of American Art**: Focuses on showcasing American art from the 20th and 21st centuries, with a strong emphasis on living artists.
5. **The Brooklyn Museum**: The second-largest art museum in New York City, featuring a diverse collection of art and artifacts from around the world, including works by Frida Kahlo, Jean-Michel Basquiat, and Keith Haring.
6. **The Frick Collection**: A small but impressive museum housed in the former mansion of Henry Clay Frick, featuring Old Master paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts.
7. **The New Museum**: A contemporary art museum in the Lower East Side, known for its innovative exhibitions and avant-garde installations.
8. **El Museo del Barrio**: A museum dedicated to Latin American and Caribbean art and culture, featuring a diverse collection of paintings, sculptures, and installations.
9. **The Morgan Library & Museum**: A stunning Beaux-Arts building housing a vast collection of rare books, manuscripts, and art, including works by da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Rembrandt.
10. **The Museum of Arts and Design (MAD)**: A museum showcasing contemporary art and design, with a focus on craftsmanship, materials, and process.

These are just a few of the many amazing museums NYC has to offer. You can easily spend days exploring each one, so prioritize based on your interests and schedule!

Which ones catch your attention?
